medical_history.chief_complaint: Worsening edema, orthopnea, and dyspnea on exertion.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient experienced one week of worsening bilateral lower extremity edema, orthopnea, and dyspnea on exertion despite increasing daily Lasix. Symptoms aggravated by progressive exhaustion and poor oral intake, with noted pillow orthopnea requiring typically two pillows for sleep.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD), atrial fibrillation (Afib), heart failure with preserved ejection fraction (HFpEF), stage III chronic kidney disease (CKD), diabetes mellitus (DM), and severe aplastic anemia treated with cyclosporine and eltrombopag.
medical_history.family_history: Mother had breast cancer. Father had lung cancer. No known family history of hematologic malignancies.
